result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome Addison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered costs, fees and surcharges waived due to low income.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court STAYED the commencement until 12-30-2015. If defendant provide proper food preparation permit, Court will allow sentence to be served on ES.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

Fine of $600.00 including costs to be paid from bail on deposit and any balance by 01-25-2016 or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  NOTE:  Court directs the Clerk of Courts Office to notify the Department of Motor Vehicles that ZERO DAYS (0 days) REVOCATION should be imposed in this case.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome Addison

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: per order dated June 9, 2016, Appeal 2016XX846CR, the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to August 5, 2016.
Count one, per clerical error.  Assessments  on count one deleted from CCAP.  Court waived as to count one at sentencing.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 674
cf
Scanned Jury Questions.vmb

Sentencing proceeded as to Count TWO: 

Fine of $600.00 including costs to be paid from bail on deposit and any balance by 1-25-16 or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant. 

NOTE:  Court directs the Clerk of Courts Office to notify the Department of Motor Vehicles that  ZERO DAYS (0 days) REVOCATION should be imposed in this case.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Jerome Addison in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded as to count one:

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court stayed the commencment until 12-30-15. If defendant provide proper food preparation permit, court will allow sentence to be served on ES.  Court ordered costs, fees and surcharges waived due to low income.

Defendant Jerome Addison in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Trial continued. Jury in box at 9:30am.   State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: Jerome A.  Exhibit 13 received.    Defense rests.  Sworn for state as rebuttal witness:  Officer Marlin Schilcher.  Jury out of box.  Jury in box.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:05 to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputy  Rob Harrison  who were duly sworn for that purpose.  At the hour of 1:45pm  the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of Guilty which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. On motion of the State, Court ordered exhibits 10 and 11 returned to the proferring parties.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerome Addison in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:06.  Jury out of box at noon. 
Jury in box at 2:15pm.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Officer Marlin Schilcher. Exhibits 1,2,6,7 received.   Jury out of box. Jury in box. Sworn in for the State:  Officer Joseph Stoevich.  Exhibits 3,4,5,9,10,11, 12 and 8 received.   Jury out of box.

Defendant Jerome Addison in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle. 
 Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Hearing proceeded.  Defense remains in contest posture.  No outstanding issues.  Additional discovery turned over to defense on today.  Parties prepared to proceed to trial on the next date as to Count 1 only.  Case remains set for Jury Trial on 10-19-15 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 47.

Defendant Jerome Addison in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for final pretrial on 10-08-15 at 8:30 and  jury trial in Branch 47. lr  Jury trial scheduled for 10-19-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerome Addison in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State's motion to adjourn is granted by the Court.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch
47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 08-28-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerome Addison in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties remain ready to proceed to trial. Case adjourned to branch 47 for Jury Trial on 8/10/2015 at 8:30 am.
Received and Filed, State's Motion in Limine.
Received and Filed, State's Jury Instructions.
Receive and Filed, State's Witness List.

Defendant Jerome Addison in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Court denied all three motions from the defense. Court denied state's motion for special Jury Instructions. Defense requests a Jury Trial date. State requests a Final Pretrial date. Court granted both requests. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerome Addison in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Court adjourned case for Decision on Motion Hearing. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Decision scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Defendant's Reply Brief for Jury Instructions.
Received and Filed, Defendant's Reply Brief on Motion to Dismiss For Defective Complaint.
Received and Filed, Defendant's Reply Brief on Vagueness.

State filed notice of motion and motion for special jury instructions; state's reply to defendant's motion to dismiss alleging vagueness of the statutory regimes related to carrying a concealed weapon; state's request for jury instructions; state's reply to defendant's motion to dismiss. lr
Defense filed proposed jury instruction; motion to dismiss complaint.

Defendant Jerome Addison in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 47. lr  Motion hearing scheduled for 05-26-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jerome Addison in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 04-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerome Addison in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Defendant is not eligible for public defender.   Court ordered case adjourned for status  ON COUNSEL  in Branch  47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 03-04-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered the Defendant not to be in possession of any firearms or weapons; and no possession of any illegal drugs without a valid prescription.

Defendant Jerome Addison in court.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. Defendant states he will represent himself he does not want public defender representation.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
